content.description: Beginning, middle, and end are all cruxes. Be careful. Start low on the gap on the lowest rail with both hands matched. Move right and up, then back left and top out just right of Dragon's Rage
Stand start on the right facing holds of Seduce the Dragon.  big move up and left to the jugs and follow the obvious jug rail until the end.
content.location: start on the 2 right facing holds of Seduce the Dragon.

content.description: Classic highball with a spicy dyno. Enjoy!
content.protection: How many pads you got? >=4 pads

content.description: This is a long problem so be ready. Flash all of it and I'll buy you a beer (or soda). Plenty of moves with little for feet. The crux is knowing the beta and getting out of the main overhang. Start low with a left side pull and right high crimp. Work along the Natural rails going left then go slightly right. Not the same top as Dragon's Rage.
content.location: Right side of the cave. Most natural line with noticeable ledges leading to the start holds. See picture

content.description: Sit start on the right side of the large ledge, work up to underclings, then up to a crimp.  The crux is a dyno to the lip, followed by a straight forward top out.
content.location: Left side of the cave on the far right of the large ledge.

pathTokens: EM: Sage Mountain Recreation Area Missouri

content.description: A bit of a walk but the most iconic part of Sage. Highballs that could be done up to 40 feet.
